Class UDPCommunicationHandler

    public class UDPCommunicationHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    Handle all UDP communication

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNewController(ControllerCommunicator controller) 
      static java.util.List<java.net.InetAddress> getBroadcastAddresses()
      We shall collect broadcast addresses from all interfaces of local network (except for those in range 10.1.x.x, because we have been forbidden those)
      static UDPCommunicationHandler getInstance() 
      boolean isThereAnotherServer() 
      void run()
      Thread run method, await arrival of a UDP packet and resolve it, currently supported: LOOKING_FOR_SERVER_MESSAGE -> client is looking on broadcast for server, server will send him its ip other discovery messages -> ignore them (I_AM_THE_SERVER_MESSAGE and LOOKING_FOR_CONTROLLERS_MESSAGE) controller packets -> always have message length of 16, send them to ControllerCommunicator according to the packets ip
      static void sendUDPPacket(byte[] data, java.util.List<java.net.InetAddress> ips)
      Send udp packet containing data to all ips
      void stopSocket()

      • getBroadcastAddresses

        public static java.util.List<java.net.InetAddress> getBroadcastAddresses()
        We shall collect broadcast addresses from all interfaces of local network (except for those in range 10.1.x.x, because we have been forbidden those)
        Returns:
        list of broadcast addresses

      • isThereAnotherServer

        public boolean isThereAnotherServer()

      • sendUDPPacket

        public static void sendUDPPacket(byte[] data,
                                 java.util.List<java.net.InetAddress> ips)
        Send udp packet containing data to all ips
        Parameters:
        data - contents of udp packet
        ips - addresses to which packet will be sent

      • run

        public void run()
        Thread run method, await arrival of a UDP packet and resolve it, currently supported: LOOKING_FOR_SERVER_MESSAGE -> client is looking on broadcast for server, server will send him its ip other discovery messages -> ignore them (I_AM_THE_SERVER_MESSAGE and LOOKING_FOR_CONTROLLERS_MESSAGE) controller packets -> always have message length of 16, send them to ControllerCommunicator according to the packets ip
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • stopSocket

        public void stopSocket()
